Chapter 5 Individual Behavior Some significant applications are demonstrated in this chapter. 5.1 Competition to Gain Association Models 5.2 Rescorla-Wagner Model 5.3 Attention Models 5.3.1 Mackintosh 5.3.2 Pearce-Hall 5.4 Behavioral Momentum 5.5 Matching Equations 5.6 Discounting Equations [Intro to topic.] 5.6.1 Exponential Model \[\begin{equation} V = Ae^{kd} \tag{5.1} \end{equation}\] 5.6.2 Hyperbolic Model [Rationale] \[\begin{equation} V = \frac{A}{1+kD} \tag{5.2} \end{equation}\] 5.6.3 Discounting + Sensitivity Models [Rationale] #### Hyperboloid Models \[\begin{equation} V = \frac {A}{(1+kD)^s} \tag{5.3} \end{equation}\] \[\begin{equation} V = \frac {A}{1+kD^s} \tag{5.4} \end{equation}\] 5.6.4 Multiple Reinforcer Dimensions 5.6.4.1 Additive 5.6.4.2 Multiplicative 5.7 Demand Equations 5.8 Hyperbolic Model of Reinforcer Value 5.9 Carrying Experiences Through Time 5.9.1 Temporal Weighting Rule 5.10 Combining Models 5.10.1 Resurgence as Choice
